Elaboration: The oracle bones are like an upright mouse with some small spots around them, like bitten debris. One said that the small dot means that the font is " small ", which means that the body of the mouse is small (Huang Dekuan). Chu Department of text head protruding tooth, represents a sharp rat teeth; or by " Lu " side or " to the next, as a sound character."

Oracle is used as a person's name, such as "Broom (Wu) Rat". "Shuowen": "Mouse, the general name of caveworms. Pictograms. All rats belong to the mouse." "Suowen" is the general name of cave-dwelling beasts based on the original meaning. This usage is not seen in ancient books. " Mouse " means mouse. Such as "Poetry. Wei Feng. Shuo Shu: "Shu Shu Shu Shu, I have no food." An Da Jian is the same. Another example is "Zuo Zhuan. "The Twenty-Three Years of Xianggong": "Husband rat, day and night moving, not in the sleeping temple, afraid of others."

Qin bamboo slips are also known as " Yi ", as in the Qin bamboo slips "Eighteen Laws of Qin." "Golden Bulu" Jane 73-74: "The governor of the capital, Shi did not have fifteen people, seven or more rats (Yo), carts, cattle, servants, those who did not have seven people, three or more rats (Yo) raised one person. "

mouse
Basic explanation of words
mouse
shÇ”
A family of mammals whose incisors continue to grow throughout their lives. They often use rodents to shorten them. They reproduce quickly and have many types. Some can spread pathogens such as plague, harm agriculture, forestry and grasslands, steal food, destroy storage, buildings, etc. (Commonly known as "mouse"): rat. Rat gall. The mouse is short-sighted. Throw the rat avoidance device. Rat generation.
Secret worries: mouse thinking.
mouse
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[â‘ ] [shÇ”]
["Guangyun" Shu Lvqie, Shangyu, book. ]
(1) A family of mammals. There are many species, the general body is small, the tail is long, the incisors are well-developed, and there is no tooth root, and they continue to grow throughout their lives. They often use biting objects to shorten them. It has no canine teeth, brown or black fur, and is very fertile. Rats harm agriculture, forestry and grasslands, steal food, destroy storage, buildings, etc., and some can spread plague, hemorrhagic fever and other diseases. It is commonly called a mouse, and in some areas it is called a rat.
(2) One of the zodiac signs. The "child" that governs the earth branch.
(3) Residence.
(4) Anger, depression. See "Mouse".
(5) Give.
(6) Rat disease.
